publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2108 Jackie Baillie: Early Introduction of Consumer Credit Bill—That the Parliament welcomes the inclusion of a consumer credit bill in the Queen’s Speech; notes that, whilst debt enforcement is a devolved issue, the regulation of credit is reserved to Westminster; recognises that, in order to tackle the growing problem of debt in Scotland, action is required in both parliaments; notes that the current legislation is 30-years-old and inadequate; welcomes the opportunity for specific Scottish reforms afforded by the bill, and urges the UK Government to ensure that the proposed Consumer Credit Bill is introduced at a sufficiently early date to allow a successful passage through Westminster before dissolution, if this is to occur in 2005.

S2M-2108 Early Introduction of Consumer Credit Bill (lodged on 2 December 2004) Shiona Baird*, Robert Brown*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Robin Harper*, Margaret Jamieson*, Mike Pringle*, Sarah Boyack*, Ms Wendy Alexander*, Alex Neil*, Marlyn Glen*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Nora Radcliffe*
S2M-2108 Early Introduction of Consumer Credit Bill (lodged on 2 December 2004) Frances Curran*, Mike Watson*, Marilyn Livingstone*, Cathie Craigie*, Christine Grahame*
S2M-2108 Early Introduction of Consumer Credit Bill (lodged on 2 December 2004) Trish Godman*, Donald Gorrie*, Mrs Mary Mulligan*, Cathy Peattie*
S2M-2108 Early Introduction of Consumer Credit Bill (lodged on 2 December 2004) Christine May*
S2M-2108 Early Introduction of Consumer Credit Bill (lodged on 2 December 2004) Susan Deacon*
S2M-2108 Early Introduction of Consumer Credit Bill (lodged on 2 December 2004) Mr Jamie Stone*
S2M-2108 Early Introduction of Consumer Credit Bill (lodged on 2 December 2004) John Farquhar Munro*
S2M-2108 Early Introduction of Consumer Credit Bill (lodged on 2 December 2004) Elaine Smith*
S2M-2108 Early Introduction of Consumer Credit Bill (lodged on 2 December 2004) Murray Tosh*
S2M-2108 Early Introduction of Consumer Credit Bill (lodged on 2 December 2004) John Swinburne*
